data.title: Henry VI of England (King of England and Lord of Ireland)
data.meta_description: Henry VI was an English monarch who reigned from 1422-1461 and again from 1470-1471. He was the only child of King Henry V, who had died in 1422, and was...
data.text:
Henry VI of England

Profession: King of England and Lord of Ireland

Biography: Henry VI was an English monarch who reigned from 1422-1461 and again from 1470-1471. He was the only child of King Henry V, who had died in 1422, and was born on December 6th 1421. At the age of nine months he was crowned King of England, and he was also King of France until 1453.

Henry VI was a weak ruler who was prone to bouts of mental illness. He was unable to prevent civil war between the House of Lancaster and the House of York, and was eventually deposed in 1461. He was briefly restored to power in 1470, but was soon deposed again.

Henry VI eventually died in the Tower of London in 1471, bringing an end to the civil wars. He left behind no heirs, and was succeeded by the House of York's Edward IV. Henry VI's reign was short and turbulent, but he was remembered for his piety and generosity.

Born: December 6, 1421

Birthplace: Windsor Castle, Berkshire, England

Star Sign: Sagittarius

Died: May 21, 1471 (aged 49)

Articles and Photos

Battle of Tewkesbury

King Edward IV and his Yorkist troops are beseeched by a priest to stop the pursuit of their Lancastrian foes who requested sanctuary from the abbey

Historical Events

Henry VI becomes King of England at the age of 9 months

King Henry VI of England crowned King of France (only English monarch to wear both crowns)

Eton College founded in England by Henry VI

Foundation stone laid for King's College Chapel in Cambridge by King Henry VI, one of England's finest medieval buildings (main structure complete 1515)

Jack Cade's Rebellion: Kentishmen revolt begins against King Henry VI and they march towards London

Opening battle in England's 30-year Wars of the Roses. Richard of York takes St Albans, capturing King Henry VI

Wars of the Roses: Richard of York defeats King Henry VI at the Battle of Northampton, Henry VI is captured

Wars of the Roses: Battle of Wakefield (Northern England), Duke of York killed and his forces soundly defeated by forces of King Henry VI

Wars of the Roses: Second Battle of St Albans - Lancastrian army defeats Yorkists and recaptures King Henry VI

Wars of the Roses: Battle of Towton - Duke Edward of York defeats the Lancastrian army, deposes King Henry VI and Queen Margaret of Anjou and proclaims himself as King Edward IV

Yorkist Edward IV crowned King of England after deposing Henry VI from the House of Lancaster

Wars of the Roses: Henry VI of England returns to the English throne after Earl of Warwick defeats Yorkists in battle

Wars of the Roses: King Edward IV of England seizes London from Henry VI

Personal Life

Margaret of Anjou weds King Henry VI of England in Titchfield, Hampshire

References

History of the Chapel - Kings College Cambridge

Famous Kings

Alexander the Great

Constantine I

Faisal of Saudi Arabia

Gustav Vasa

Henry II of Castile

Louis XVI
